newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania to auction rollover T-bills next week.
newsitem.headline: Romania to auction rollover T-bills next week.

text.p: Romania's Finance Ministry said on Friday it would launch a rollover treasury bill issue next week to be placed through auction under new government securities trading rules.
The pilot auction for the 501 billion lei worth of 91-day bills will be on April 22 using the Dutch auction method.
The issue's official date is coded 1997/I, with an issue date on April 24, when some ministry papers are due to mature.
Each investor, banks operating in Romania and their corporate clients, can submit five competitive bids of minimum 100 million lei each.
Results of the auction will be available on April 23 and settlement is the issue date.
In past years, the finance minister funded budget deficits through several T-bills, most of them with 91-days maturity, placed through public subscription.
On Thursday, it offered 598.54 billion lei in fixed-interest T-bills with an annual yield of 164.35 percent, compared with short-term money market prices of about 100 percent.
Results of the subscription were not avaialble but traders said it was heavily oversubscribed.
